metadata.titleCn: Daily water vapor and precipitation isotopes in Nanjing of eastern China
metadata.description: 1) Data content: species list and distribution data of Phrynocephalus and Eremais in Tarim Basin, including class, order, family, genus, species, and detailed distribution information including country, province, city and county; 2) Data source and processing method: Based on the field survey of amphibians and reptiles in Tarim Basin from 2008 to 2020, and recording the species composition and distribution range of Phrynocephalus and Eremias in this area; 3) Data quality description: the investigation, collection and identification of samples are all conducted by professionals, and the collection of samples information are checked to ensure the quality of distribution data; 4) Data application results and prospects: Through comprehensive analysis of the dataset, the list of species diversity and distribution can provide important data for biodiversity cataloguing in arid central Asia, and provide scientific basis for assessing biodiversity pattern and formulating conservation strategies.
metadata.descriptionCn: This dataset includes daily water vapor and precipitation isotopes (δ18O and δD) and daily meteorological parameters including temperature, relative humidity, vapor concentration, air pressure, and precipitation amount at Nanjing, eastern China. Water vapor isotopes (δ18Ov and δDv) were online measured during November 2012 to December 2018 by a Wavelength Scanned Cavity Ring-Down Spectrometer (WS-CRDS, model: Picarro L2120-i) at the Station for Observing Regional Processes of the Earth System of Nanjing University (SORPES-NJU, 32.12°N, 118.95°E, 55 m above sea level) on the Xianlin Campus of the Nanjing University, about 20 km east of downtown Nanjing in the Eastern China. The uncertainties were determined to be less than 0.2‰ for δ18Ov and 1.0‰ for δDv. Precipitation isotopes were also measured by Picarro L2120-i during September 2011 to December 2018, with the analytical uncertainty of less than 0.1‰ for δ18O and 0.5‰ for δD.

background: There are about 1,200 lakes (>1 km2) on the Tibetan Plateau (TP; Zhang, Yao, Xie, Qin, et al., 2014), and many studies have shown that lake ice phenology (i.e., the timing of freezeup, breakup, and duration of ice cover) responds well to climatic and environmental changes (Brown & Duguay, 2010; Weber et al., 2016). As “the Third Pole of the Earth,” the TP is very sensitive to global climate change (Kang et al., 2010; Liu & Chen, 2000; Qiu, 2008). Changes in air and water surface temperatures related to climatic changes are important factors in the lake ice phenology changes (Adrian et al., 2009; Dörnhöfer & Oppelt, 2016; Yao et al., 2016; Zhang, Yao, Xie, Zhang, et al., 2014). At the same time, the state and type of lake ice and their change to open water system in turn affect the local or regional climate (Brown & Duguay, 2010; Rouse et al., 2005). However, due to the harsh environment and limited accessibility, few meteorological stations exist in the central and western TP where lakes are concentrated; thus, it is difficult to carry out field observations. The unique geographical and climatic conditions of the TP make it a region of high interest for climate research (Kang et al., 2010).
research objective: To obtain the lake ice phenology variations on the TP, the daily snow products of MODIS are used to extract the freezeup and breakup dates of lake‐wide ice cover from 2001 to 2017. In addition, possible influence of geographical determined lake locations and physico‐chemical conditions on lake ice phenology are also investigated.
challenges: However, due to the harsh environment and limited accessibility, few meteorological stations exist in the central and western TP where lakes are concentrated; thus, it is difficult to carry out field observations. These factors result in a lack of continuous and complete historical records on regional climate changes.
methods: By analyzing the freezeup/breakup characteristics for each lake on the TP, 58 lakes with a stable ice cover period (less cloud cover, less pixel misclassification, and obvious ice cover period) are manually selected as study lakes. The data were obtained from the U.S. National Snow and Ice Data Center (http://nsidc.org/; version 5 for 2001–2016 and version 6 for 2017) on 8 September 2017. To extract lake ice, pixels covering a lake need to be first distinguished from other types of pixels, such as cloud and land. A threshold of 0.4 for Normalized Difference Snow Index (NDSI; Hall et al., 2001) is applied to extract the extent of a lake. The cloud removal (gapfilling) process has two steps. The first step is to combine daily Terra and Aqua snow cover products to determine lake cover type. The second step is based on the temporal correlation of cloud cover pixels. First, if a pixel on date t is cloud covered, the pixels on the images of previous and next days will be searched, and if both pixels are covered by water, pixel on date t is determined to be covered by water.
dataset: The available daily snow cover products with a spatial resolution of 500 m from MODIS include MOD10A1 (Terra) and MYD10A1 (Aqua). The available temporal range of MOD10A1 is from 1 August 2000 to 31 July 2017 and that of MYD10A1 is from 1 August 2002 to 31 July 2017. Four MODIS tiles (h24v05, h25v05, h25v06, and h26v05) cover the 58 lakes of this study. The Landsat program is a series of Earth observing satellites, which is comanaged by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration and the United States Geological Survey to monitor Earth and environmental resources. Since 23 July 1972, eight satellites have been launched including Landsat Multispectral Scanner (MSS; ~80 m) and Thematic Mapper (TM; 30 m)/Enhanced Thematic Mapper Plus (ETM+; 30 m)/Operational Land Imager (OLI; 30 m) with a temporal resolution of 16 days.
findings: Over 17 years, the mean ice cover duration of 58 lakes is 157.78 days, 18 (31%) lakes have a mean extending rate of 1.11 day/year, and 40 (69%) lakes have a mean shortening rate of 0.80 day/year.
backgroundCn: 在青藏高原（TP）上有大约1200个湖泊（面积大于1平方公里）（Zhang, Yao, Xie, Qin等，2014），许多研究表明，湖冰物候（即结冰、融冰的时间及冰盖持续时间）对气候和环境变化的响应良好（Brown & Duguay, 2010；Weber等，2016）。作为“地球的第三极”，青藏高原对全球气候变化非常敏感（Kang等，2010；Liu & Chen，2000；Qiu，2008）。与气候变化相关的空气和水面温度变化是湖冰物候变化的重要因素（Adrian等，2009；Dörnhöfer & Oppelt，2016；Yao等，2016；Zhang, Yao, Xie, Zhang等，2014）。与此同时，湖冰的状态和类型及其转变为开水系统反过来又影响当地或区域气候（Brown & Duguay, 2010；Rouse等，2005）。然而，由于环境恶劣和可达性有限，青藏高原中部和西部湖泊集中地区的气象站数量较少，因此进行实地观测非常困难。青藏高原独特的地理和气候条件使其成为气候研究的高关注区域（Kang等，2010）。
research objectiveCn: 为了获取青藏高原湖泊冰期的变化，使用MODIS的每日雪产品提取2001年至2017年湖泊冰盖的冻结和解冻日期。此外，还研究了地理位置和物理化学条件对湖泊冰期的可能影响。
challengesCn: 然而，由于环境恶劣和可达性有限，集中湖泊的青藏高原中部和西部仅有少数气象站，因此难以进行实地观测。这些因素导致该地区气候变化的连续和完整历史记录缺乏。
methodsCn: 通过分析每个湖泊的冰冻/解冻特征，手动选择了58个具有稳定冰盖期的湖泊作为研究湖泊（较少的云覆盖、较少的像素误分类以及明显的冰盖期）。数据来自美国国家雪冰数据中心（http://nsidc.org/；2001-2016年版本5，2017年版本6），于2017年9月8日获取。为了提取湖冰，首先需要将覆盖湖泊的像素与其他类型的像素（如云和陆地）区分开来。应用归一化差异雪指数（NDSI；Hall等，2001）的0.4阈值来提取湖泊的范围。云去除（填补缺口）过程分为两个步骤。第一步是结合每日的Terra和Aqua雪覆盖产品来确定湖泊覆盖类型。第二步基于云覆盖像素的时间相关性。如果在日期t的像素被云覆盖，将搜索前后两天图像中的像素，如果这两个像素都被水覆盖，则日期t的像素被确定为被水覆盖。
datasetCn: 可用的每日雪盖产品，空间分辨率为500米，来自MODIS，包括MOD10A1（Terra）和MYD10A1（Aqua）。MOD10A1的可用时间范围为2000年8月1日至2017年7月31日，而MYD10A1的可用时间范围为2002年8月1日至2017年7月31日。四个MODIS瓦片（h24v05、h25v05、h25v06和h26v05）覆盖了本研究的58个湖泊。Landsat计划是一系列地球观测卫星，由美国国家航空航天局和美国地质调查局共同管理，用于监测地球和环境资源。自1972年7月23日以来，已发射了八颗卫星，包括Landsat多光谱扫描仪（MSS；约80米）和主题映射仪（TM；30米）/增强主题映射仪（ETM+；30米）/操作土地成像仪（OLI；30米），其时间分辨率为16天。
findingsCn: 在17年间，58个湖泊的平均冰盖持续时间为157.78天，其中18个湖泊（31%）的平均延长率为每年1.11天，40个湖泊（69%）的平均缩短率为每年0.80天。

Verification.QuestionEn: Is there a lack of continuous and complete historical records on regional climate changes in the central and western Tibetan Plateau due to limited accessibility?
Verification.QuestionCn: 由于可达性有限，中央和西部青藏 Plateau 的区域气候变化缺乏连续和完整的历史记录吗？

Verification.QuestionEn: Can the MODIS daily snow cover products be used to determine lake ice phenology on the Tibetan Plateau?
Verification.QuestionCn: MODIS每日雪盖产品可以用于确定青藏高原的湖冰物候吗？

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when collecting meteorological data in regions with limited accessibility?
Example.QuestionCn: 在可达性有限的地区收集气象数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: In the Tibetan Plateau, due to the harsh environment and limited accessibility, there are few meteorological stations in the central and western areas where lakes are concentrated, making it difficult to conduct field observations.
Example.AnswerCn: 在青藏高原，由于环境恶劣和交通不便，湖泊集中地区的中部和西部只有少量气象站，导致现场观测困难。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset used to study lake ice phenology on the Tibetan Plateau?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于研究青藏高原湖泊冰期现象的数据集示例？
Example.AnswerEn: The dataset includes daily snow cover products from MODIS, specifically MOD10A1 (Terra) and MYD10A1 (Aqua), which have a spatial resolution of 500 m and cover the temporal range from 1 August 2000 to 31 July 2017.
Example.AnswerCn: 该数据集包括来自MODIS的每日雪盖产品，具体为MOD10A1（Terra）和MYD10A1（Aqua），其空间分辨率为500米，时间范围为2000年8月1日至2017年7月31日。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific challenges are associated with collecting continuous historical climate data in remote regions like the Tibetan Plateau?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在像青藏高原这样的偏远地区收集连续历史气候数据面临哪些具体挑战？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: harsh environment, limited accessibility, few meteorological stations, lack of continuous and complete historical records
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 恶劣环境、有限的可达性、稀少的气象站、缺乏连续和完整的历史记录

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What properties and features are considered when extracting lake ice cover data from satellite imagery?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 从卫星影像中提取湖冰覆盖数据时，会考虑哪些属性和特征？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: MODIS daily snow products, spatial resolution of 500 m, threshold of 0.4 for the Normalized Difference Snow Index (NDSI), cloud removal process through temporal correlation of cloud cover pixels
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: MODIS每日雪产品，空间分辨率为500米，归一化差异雪指数（NDSI）的阈值为0.4，通过云覆盖像素的时间相关性进行云去除处理。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'lake ice phenology' refer to in the context of climate studies on the Tibetan Plateau?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在气候研究中，“湖冰物候”在青藏高原的背景下指的是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Lake ice phenology refers to the study of seasonal ice cover changes on lakes, including the timing of freeze-up and break-up, as well as the duration of ice cover. It is an important indicator of climatic and environmental changes, particularly on the Tibetan Plateau where these dynamics are sensitive to global climate change.
Definition.AnswerCn: 湖冰物候学是研究湖泊季节性冰盖变化的学科，包括结冰和融冰的时间以及冰盖持续时间。它是气候和环境变化的重要指标，特别是在对全球气候变化敏感的青藏高原上。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in collecting continuous and complete historical records of regional climate changes, and how might these challenges affect data interpretation?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在收集区域气候变化的连续和完整历史记录时可能面临哪些挑战，这些挑战可能如何影响数据解释？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The challenges in collecting continuous and complete historical records of regional climate changes include harsh environmental conditions and limited accessibility, especially in areas with few meteorological stations like the central and western Tibetan Plateau. These factors can lead to gaps in data, making it difficult to interpret long-term climate trends accurately.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 收集区域气候变化的连续和完整历史记录面临的挑战包括恶劣的环境条件和有限的可达性，特别是在气象站稀少的中部和西部青藏高原地区。这些因素可能导致数据的缺口，使得准确解读长期气候趋势变得困难。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What can be inferred about the impact of geographical and physico-chemical conditions on lake ice phenology from the use of MODIS daily snow products in data collection?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 从使用MODIS每日雪产品进行数据收集中可以推断出地理和物理化学条件对湖冰物候的影响是什么？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The use of MODIS daily snow products allows for the extraction of lake ice phenology variations by analyzing freezeup and breakup dates of lake-wide ice cover. This approach helps infer that geographical location and physico-chemical conditions significantly influence lake ice phenology, as these factors determine the timing and duration of ice cover, as well as the response of lakes to climatic changes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用MODIS日雪产品可以通过分析湖泊冰盖的冻结和融化日期来提取湖冰物候变化。这种方法有助于推断地理位置和物理化学条件对湖冰物候的显著影响，因为这些因素决定了冰盖的时间和持续时间，以及湖泊对气候变化的响应。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in collecting continuous and complete historical records for regional climate changes in areas like the Tibetan Plateau?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在像青藏高原这样的地区，收集连续和完整的历史气候变化记录面临的挑战包括哪些因素？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Factors such as the harsh environment, limited accessibility, and the scarcity of meteorological stations in the central and western Tibetan Plateau where lakes are concentrated contribute to the challenges in collecting continuous and complete historical records for regional climate changes.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 诸如恶劣的环境、有限的可达性以及中央和西部青藏 Plateau 湖泊集中地区气象站的稀缺等因素，导致收集该地区气候变化的连续和完整历史记录面临挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to carry out field observations in the central and western Tibetan Plateau, and how do these difficulties influence data collection methods?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在青藏高原中部和西部进行实地观测很困难，这些困难如何影响数据收集方法？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The difficulty in carrying out field observations in the central and western Tibetan Plateau is due to the harsh environment and limited accessibility. These challenges necessitate the use of remote sensing data, such as MODIS snow cover products, to study lake ice phenology in the region.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在中部和西部的青藏高原进行实地观察的困难主要是由于恶劣的环境和有限的可达性。这些挑战使得需要使用遥感数据，如MODIS雪盖产品，以研究该地区的湖冰物候。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the lack of continuous and complete historical records on regional climate changes influence the reliability of the data collected from the Tibetan Plateau?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 区域气候变化的连续和完整历史记录的缺乏如何影响从青藏高原收集的数据的可靠性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The lack of continuous and complete historical records on regional climate changes due to limited accessibility and harsh environmental conditions in the central and western Tibetan Plateau can lead to gaps in data, affecting the reliability of field observations and long-term climate trend analyses. This makes it challenging to establish accurate baselines and assess changes over time.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 由于中西藏高原的可及性有限和恶劣的环境条件，缺乏连续和完整的区域气候变化历史记录，这可能导致数据的缺口，从而影响现场观察和长期气候趋势分析的可靠性。这使得建立准确的基线和评估随时间变化变得具有挑战性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What impact does the application of a threshold for Normalized Difference Snow Index (NDSI) have on the extraction of lake ice cover data?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 应用归一化差异雪指数（NDSI）阈值对湖面冰盖数据提取的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Applying a threshold of 0.4 for the Normalized Difference Snow Index (NDSI) helps distinguish lake ice from cloud and land pixels, facilitating the extraction of lake ice cover data. This method enhances the accuracy of detecting ice extent, although it relies on the assumption that the threshold effectively discriminates between these surface types, which may not always be the case in complex or mixed conditions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 应用0.4的归一化差异雪指数（NDSI）阈值有助于区分湖冰与云和陆地像素，从而促进湖冰覆盖数据的提取。这种方法提高了冰面范围检测的准确性，尽管它依赖于阈值有效区分这些表面类型的假设，但在复杂或混合条件下，这种假设可能并不总是成立。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the goals behind manually selecting lakes with stable ice cover periods for research on the Tibetan Plateau?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 手动选择冰盖稳定期的湖泊进行研究的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to accurately identify freezeup and breakup characteristics by focusing on lakes with minimal cloud cover and pixel misclassification. This selection ensures reliable data extraction and analysis, enabling researchers to study the effects of climate change on lake ice phenology more effectively.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是通过关注云层覆盖较少和像素误分类最小的湖泊，准确识别冰封和解冻特征。这一选择确保了可靠的数据提取和分析，使研究人员能够更有效地研究气候变化对湖泊冰相现象的影响。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can the geographical and climatic conditions of a region influence the data collection process for lake ice phenology?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 一个地区的地理和气候条件如何影响湖泊冰现象的数据收集过程？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The unique geographical and climatic conditions, such as those on the Tibetan Plateau, make it a region of high interest for climate research. However, the harsh environment and limited accessibility mean that few meteorological stations exist, making it difficult to carry out field observations and resulting in a lack of continuous and complete historical records on regional climate changes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 独特的地理和气候条件，例如在青藏高原，使其成为气候研究的高关注区域。然而，恶劣的环境和有限的可达性意味着气象站数量稀少，难以进行实地观测，导致该地区气候变化的连续和完整历史记录缺乏。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural steps are involved in extracting lake ice phenology data from satellite imagery?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 从卫星影像中提取湖冰物候数据涉及哪些程序步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To extract lake ice phenology, daily snow products of MODIS are used. The procedure involves selecting lakes with stable ice cover periods, identifying lake pixels using a threshold for Normalized Difference Snow Index (NDSI), and applying a cloud removal process. This process includes combining daily Terra and Aqua snow cover products and using temporal correlations of cloud cover pixels to determine lake cover type.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了提取湖泊冰期，使用MODIS的每日雪产品。该过程包括选择具有稳定冰盖期的湖泊，使用归一化差异雪指数（NDSI）阈值识别湖泊像素，并应用云去除过程。该过程包括结合每日的Terra和Aqua雪盖产品，并利用云覆盖像素的时间相关性来确定湖泊覆盖类型。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do geographical conditions influence the ability to conduct field observations for lake ice phenology on the Tibetan Plateau?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 地理条件如何影响在青藏高原进行湖泊冰相观测的能力？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Geographical conditions such as the harsh environment and limited accessibility in the central and western Tibetan Plateau, where lakes are concentrated, make it difficult to carry out field observations, resulting in a lack of continuous and complete historical records on regional climate changes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 地理条件如中央和西部青藏高原的恶劣环境和有限的可达性，使得进行实地观察变得困难，从而导致该地区气候变化的连续和完整历史记录缺乏。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or methodologies enable the extraction of accurate lake ice phenology data from remote sensing sources?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件或方法论能够从遥感源中提取准确的湖冰物候数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The application of a threshold of 0.4 for Normalized Difference Snow Index (NDSI) and a cloud removal process that combines daily Terra and Aqua snow cover products and leverages the temporal correlation of cloud cover pixels enable the extraction of accurate lake ice phenology data from MODIS remote sensing products.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 对归一化差异雪指数（NDSI）应用0.4的阈值，以及结合每日Terra和Aqua雪盖产品的云去除过程，并利用云覆盖像素的时间相关性，使得能够从MODIS遥感产品中提取准确的湖冰物候数据。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why are the meteorological conditions in the Tibetan Plateau expected to challenge traditional data collection methods for lake ice phenology?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么青藏高原的气象条件预计会对湖冰物候的传统数据收集方法构成挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The harsh environment and limited accessibility in the Tibetan Plateau, where few meteorological stations exist, make it difficult to carry out field observations, resulting in challenges for continuous data collection on lake ice phenology.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 青藏高原的恶劣环境和有限的可达性使得气象站数量稀少，难以进行实地观测，从而导致湖泊冰相现象的连续数据收集面临挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might integrating MODIS snow cover products with other satellite data improve the understanding of lake ice phenology?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么将MODIS雪盖产品与其他卫星数据整合在一起可能改善对湖冰物候学的理解？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Integrating MODIS snow cover products with other satellite data, like Landsat, can improve understanding because MODIS provides daily observations and a broad spatial coverage, while Landsat offers higher spatial resolution, complementing each other to fill data gaps and enhance the accuracy of lake ice phenology assessments.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 将MODIS雪盖产品与其他卫星数据（如Landsat）结合使用，可以提高理解，因为MODIS提供每日观测和广泛的空间覆盖，而Landsat则提供更高的空间分辨率，二者相辅相成，可以填补数据空白，增强湖冰物候评估的准确性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the challenges faced in collecting daily water vapor and precipitation isotopes data in regions with limited accessibility, such as the Tibetan Plateau?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我对在可及性有限的地区（如青藏高原）收集每日水汽和降水同位素数据所面临的挑战的评估是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The challenges include harsh environmental conditions and limited accessibility, which make it difficult to carry out field observations and result in a lack of continuous and complete historical records on regional climate changes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 挑战包括恶劣的环境条件和有限的可达性，这使得进行实地观察变得困难，并导致区域气候变化的历史记录缺乏连续性和完整性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you assess the effectiveness of using MODIS daily snow products for extracting lake ice phenology in terms of data accuracy and methodological rigor?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何评估使用MODIS每日雪产品提取湖冰物候的有效性，从数据准确性和方法论严谨性方面来看？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of MODIS daily snow products is effective for extracting lake ice phenology by applying a threshold for the Normalized Difference Snow Index (NDSI) and using a cloud removal process, which combines daily Terra and Aqua snow cover products to determine lake cover type and fills gaps based on temporal correlation, thus ensuring accuracy and methodological rigor.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 使用MODIS日雪产品通过应用归一化差异雪指数（NDSI）阈值和云去除过程，有效提取湖冰物候。该过程结合了每日Terra和Aqua雪盖产品，以确定湖泊覆盖类型，并基于时间相关性填补缺口，从而确保准确性和方法论的严谨性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges involved in collecting meteorological data in regions with harsh climates and limited accessibility.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在气候恶劣和交通不便的地区收集气象数据所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Collecting meteorological data in regions with harsh climates and limited accessibility, such as the Tibetan Plateau, is challenging due to the lack of meteorological stations. This results in difficulties in field observations and a lack of continuous and complete historical records on regional climate changes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在气候恶劣且交通不便的地区，如青藏高原，收集气象数据面临挑战，因为气象站的缺乏导致现场观测困难，并且缺乏关于区域气候变化的连续和完整的历史记录。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please conduct a search for potential datasets that provide daily meteorological parameters similar to those collected in Nanjing, focusing on regions with similar climatic conditions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请搜索潜在的数据集，这些数据集提供与南京收集的日气象参数相似的数据，重点关注气候条件相似的地区。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets would include those providing daily meteorological parameters such as temperature, relative humidity, and air pressure. Searching within climate research centers or meteorological databases with a focus on Eastern China or similar climatic regions may yield relevant results.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括提供每日气象参数的数据，如温度、相对湿度和气压。在气候研究中心或气象数据库中搜索，重点关注东中国或类似气候区域，可能会获得相关结果。
